text: Hi, psychoff posted his profit on Brighton-Leicester and his P&L for that section of the day in response to a question, see it attached. Is there a way to get the trades for the market, it might be possible to reverse-engineer his trade on this market and hence his mode of thinking ?

elements.text: Hi, psychoff posted his profit on Brighton-Leicester and his P&L for that section of the day in response to a question, see it attached. text: No in general it would be next to impossible to reverse engineer the series of trades that lead to this outcome. Do you have the link to the original thread which lead him to post this?

text: His self promotion is to drive interest in bullshit courses with extortionate fees. The thing is; every time you show up here you're driving interest (and possibly traffic) to someone who deserves neither. Without your contributions he would not be discussed at all, which is really the ideal state of affairs. A suspicious person might even imagine that your  purpose here was to promote him.

text: So many rumours about that Berry no longer even trades now and basically got a rep because he was going OK but lost his edge. At the end of the day I don't know if that is true or not and (I couldn't care less either) but when you start selling ebooks and promoting matched betting after years of bookie bashing you have to wonder why. And getting involved in the football index stuff was probably nothing more than a chance to raise his "profile" a bit with an article in the Guardian. No doubt has a few more followers given the outcome of that debacle, but I've never watched a video or read anything he has to say that was remotely useful. As for his book.... Utter junk.

It's the stereotypical picture of someone who would write a book about how excellent they are and the way they do things is the _only_ way to do it because everyone else is inferior. HOWEVER, Andrew clearly knows what he's talking about and is nothing like the stereotype derived from his picture.

text: <@U01NU8PTC5Q> recommend that you please follow the examples here: <https://github.com/liampauling/flumine> and <https://github.com/liampauling/betfair> the people on this slack channel are more than helpful, but best to self serve as much as possible especially for basics. also recommend first having a primer on python and coding (udemy and other many online resources), that way the members of this channel will be better able to help you concretely.

text: <@U01NU8PTC5Q> the problem with helping people with programming is that often it is only possible to help with specific questions. Like if you post some code and explain what doesn't work, then someone can probably spot quite quickly what the issue is. It is really hard to give general advice though. It is not a lack of willingness to help, it is just a very hard task turning someone with no coding experience into a competent programmer via a forum. With programming you have to really get stuck in to learn how it works. The more you do that the more you learn and the more precise questions you can ask. <@U01B8031PM1> advice above is definitely the way to start. It is daunting task to learn to program from scratch but there are so many resources available. It is very frustrating to start off but it really does become very rewarding very quickly when you start to make progress. The effort really is worth it!

elements.text: the problem with helping people with programming is that often it is only possible to help with specific questions. Like if you post some code and explain what doesn't work, then someone can probably spot quite quickly what the issue is. It is really hard to give general advice though. With programming you have to really get stuck in to learn how it works. The more you do that the more you learn and the more precise questions you can ask.

advice above is definitely the way to start. It is daunting task to learn to program from scratch but there are so many resources available. It is very frustrating to start off but it really does become very rewarding very quickly when you start to make progress. The effort really is worth it!

text: I think this kind of thing is generally a bit of a grey area. It's probably best if you make sure you trade while you're using these non-documented endpoints. FYI there is also the betgenius endpoint (<https://betfair.betstream.betgenius.com/betstream-view/footballscorecentre/betfairfootballscorecentre/json?eventId=30246754> )

elements.text: I think this kind of thing is generally a bit of a grey area. It's probably best if you make sure you trade while you're using these non-documented endpoints. FYI there is also the betgenius endpoint (

text: Just a warning btw, it's often quite imprecise (time elapsed is out by a few mins, nonsensical timestamps on match events and often late for goals to show up)

elements.text: Just a warning btw, it's often quite imprecise (time elapsed is out by a few mins, nonsensical timestamps on match events and often late for goals to show up)

text:
Is that for the inplay endpoint or the bet genius one (or both)?

I only need to know the current score, so I think I might go for a belt and braces approach of getting the score from the end point, but check it makes sense by seeing which o/u markets are open.

elements.text:
Is that for the inplay endpoint or the bet genius one (or both)?

I only need to know the current score, so I think I might go for a belt and braces approach of getting the score from the end point, but check it makes sense by seeing which o/u markets are open.

text: Last statement was referring to the inplay endpoint. I haven't used the betgenius tbh, but handy to know it's there as a back up. Double checking against o/u markets makes sense, I think the goals not appearing might be in ~3-4% of cases or so. One advantage of the betgenius one is that while inplay endpoint isn't supported on every match, betgenius endpoint seems to cover a LOT more.

elements.text: Last statement was referring to the inplay endpoint. I haven't used the betgenius tbh, but handy to know it's there as a back up. Double checking against o/u markets makes sense, I think the goals not appearing might be in ~3-4% of cases or so. One advantage of the betgenius one is that while inplay endpoint isn't supported on every match, betgenius endpoint seems to cover a LOT more.

text: The goals do appear after some time btw, but sometimes takes a few mins to actually show up.

elements.text: The goals do appear after some time btw, but sometimes takes a few mins to actually show up.
